tn.text: The word "behold" here shows that Jeremiah saw something interesting.

tn.ref: This vision happened ... them to Babylon
tn.text: This part of the story is used to provide historical information to show when the events of the happened. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
people skilled at creating things out of metal.

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came to
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:01|1:2]].
The good figs are those Judean exiles sent to the land of Chaldea. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: I will set my eyes on them for good
I will build them up, and not tear them down. I will plant them, and not uproot them
tn.text: These two sentences have similar meanings. The second one strengthens the thought in the first. (See" [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]]) AT: "I will help them to prosper in Chaldea."

tn.ref: I will build them up, and not tear them down
tn.text: This expression compares the exiles to a building which Yahweh will build and not tear down. AT: "I will help them flourish in the land, and not ruin them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will plant them, and not uproot them
tn.text: AT: "I will establish them in the land, and not remove them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: they will turn to me with all their heart
tn.text: AT: "they will turn to me with their whole being" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: But like the bad figs that are too bad to be eaten
tn.text: This expression compares bad figs to bad people. Bad figs are figs which cannot be eaten and are useless, bad people do not follow Yahweh and are also useless. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: I will turn them into a frightening thing, a disaster
tn.text: Yahweh compares the coming judgment on the people of Jerusalem to something that will scare other people when they see it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I will send out sword, famine, and plague against them
tn.text: AT: "I will kill them with war, famine and sicknesses."
